verb.description: Feel or manipulate with the hands.
examples: heavy paving slabs can be difficult to handle
a lawyer's ability to handle a case properly
where did you learn to handle a boat?

noun.description: The part by which a thing is held, carried, or controlled.
examples: the pan features helpful lifting handles
that's some handle for a baby
a former Washington DJ whose handle was Fat Daddy

noun.description: The total amount of money bet over a particular time (typically at a casino) or at a particular sporting event.
examples: the monthly handle of a couple of casinos in Las Vegas

noun.description: A large bottle in which liquor is sold, typically holding one half gallon.

origin: Old English handle (noun), handlian (verb), from hand.
